title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When answering "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog and then double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the contents of the window are replaced with the original. However, if the steps 1) and 2) are repeated, and then "Revert" is selected from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The time taken to revert the file contents using "Revert" should not be more than the time taken to close and reopen the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog.
2. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
4. Select "Revert" from the pop-up menu in the editor.
5. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
